SPANISH STADIUM TOURS – NEW FOR 2026!

Barcelona and Real Madrid extravaganza

8th - 15th March 2026

What's to get excited about!

Football has become a cultural mainstay in our lives. From the global appeal of the Premier League to the upsurge in popularity of women’s football, it appears we cannot get enough of the beautiful game. But probably no country does football better than our Spanish neighbours, boasting two of the greatest clubs to ever grace a pitch – Barcelona and Real Madrid.

We know we have plenty of football fans who regularly come on our holidays, and they have inspired us to create this holiday that brings with it the opportunity to visit both these cities and experience the wonder of their respective stadiums. Therefore, we invite you to join us to discover the majestic Stadium Camp Nou, home of the Catalonian giants in Barcelona and the recently renovated Bernabéu Stadium, home of ‘Los Galácticos’, Real Madrid. Both these stadiums are colossal with capacities of over 85,000 and architecturally so impressive, yet it’s the history of the clubs that play there that we’ll be learning all about on our guided tours that will take us around the grounds and behind the seasons. Theis will include their trophy rooms which are around the most impressive (and largest!) you’re likely to see anywhere in the world.

Also, there’s no way we can visit these two great cities without taking in some of the other incredible sightseeing opportunities whilst there. In Barcelona, we’ll be taken on a guided tour of the beautiful church of Gaudi’s La Sagrada Famila, the most iconic landmark in the whole of Catalonia. We’ll also be exploring the world famous gothic quarter and taking a stroll down Las Ramblas. Likewise in Madrid, we will be receiving a guided tour of The Royal Palace, the largest palace in western Europe plus breathing in the big city atmosphere of Spain’s capital city. We will also be travelling by train from Barcelona to Madrid, which brings with it the perfect opportunity to relax and enjoy some of the wonderful Spanish countryside.

Come and join us for what is certain to be a holiday El Classico!!

Where you'll be staying...

In Barcelona we will be staying in central Hotel Rialto. Hotel Rialto occupies a historic building where the artist Joan Miró was born. It offers air-conditioned rooms with flat-screen TV. Each room at the Rialto Hotel Barcelona has wooden floors and a simple, functional design. The modern bathrooms include basic toiletries.

In Madrid we will be staying in the hotel JC Rooms Chueca which is located in Madrid city centre, in the lively neighbourhood of Chueca, only 500 metres from Puerta del Sol. Every room at this hotel is air conditioned and offers free WiFi and an HD flat-screen TV. The rooms include a private bathroom fitted with a bath or shower.

Food, glorious food!

Our breakfasts will be catered for by both of our hotels in Barcelona and Madrid. Hotel Rialto in Barcelona will also be providing us for our evening meals, a mix of delicious Mediterranean meals. We will be seeking our lunches out, tasting the best street food Spain has to offer. Our dinners in Madrid will be at nearby restaurants.

What you'll experience...

We will meet at a London airport and you will be supported on the flight to Barcelona Airport in Spain. We will catch public transport from the airport to our hotel.

Ininerary

Day 1 – Travel from London to Barcelona, travel to our accommodation via public trancport, settle in.

Day 2 – Visit Sagreda Familia.

Day 3 – Tour of Barcelona’s Nou Camp.

Day 4 – Rest Day.

Day 5 – Travel to Madrid from Barcelona by Train.

Day 6 – Tour of Real Madrd’s stadium.

Day 7 – Tour of the Madrid Royal Palace.

Day 8 – Public Transport to Madid Airport for flight back to London.

Your holiday will include the following:

  • 7-night, full board accommodation.
  • All entrance fees to all activities and sites.
  • Airport transfers and transport in and around Spain.
  • Flights from London to Barcelona and Madrid to London, accompanied and supported by our Go Beyond team.
  • A ratio of 2 guests to 1 Go Beyond support staff member.
  • Support from our Go Beyond team during the holiday.
